column4: i am still using the default install djp as my main workstation at work
no need for mp3/divx stuff etc
what do you mean with restrictive. I am having no problems working on it, though some little bugs here and there
but for "users" i think its not very usefull if you cant watch mpg files etc... though i stopped watching pr0n at the office, which i feel is a good thing :)
by restrctive, i meant in terms of file playback i suppose. ie, visitng websites and not using java, flash-plugins etc...
sounds to me that you are getting by pretty well without though!
i think i miss java, but not enough to get it installed :)
with webviewing i miss internet explorer more then flash etc :)
since some company's i work with have ie only logins :(
completely switched over now to linux... just thinking about taking the big step and trying to survuve with the totally free software thing!
i think it was installing limewire under ubuntu that made me feel that way. felt like windows all over again, pop-up messages asking me if i wanted to purchase the 'pro' version et al!
just ask you selve what you really need and stick to that :), though there are good Free download tools like gnutella etc :)
but personaly if i would need something and its non free i would use it anyways. But i wont "steal" it. if they ask money or i pay or i dont use it.
but i have one restriction i read the end user licence agreement, and dont use the software if i dont agree with it.
fair enough. sounds good to me
